While there's not much information here on how to create/reproduce this problem, some newsgroup posts (on 'foundation' newsgroup) suggests its from the project (or .project file) being read-only .... as it would be with some SCMs (that uses pessimistic file system, I think it's called). 

If true, that would be a major bug indeed! Critical even! To quote from the newsgroup posting, 

"If WTP cannot add the facet (because, for example, the .project file is 
read-only), it fails and corrupts the metadata of the WTP project. 
Unrecoverably. There's not much to do except delete and recreate it."

So, we should see if we can reproduce, possibly with a pessimistic file system simulator. (See http://help.eclipse.org/help33/index.jsp?topic=/org.eclipse.platform.doc.isv/samples/org.eclipse.team.examples.filesystem/doc-html/team_filesystem_ex.html )

I'm pretty sure that this can, indeed, be reproed with a read-only .project. That only became clear after I opened this report.

I can re-repro this for you if you like, and deliver any other artifacts of interest.
More step by step details for reproducing would be helpful thanks...
